comments.body: Some comments about why these are hard-coded to true could be useful. Is there actually an implementation step that could be needed in the future? If so, then adding a TODO here as well could be a good pointer.
Is it possible to implement stopApp by caching this Process object in a field?
We could cache the ids or process in a field on the device, however for the case of "run -> detach -> run" two processes will still be started. I'm not in love with using ps/kill though
Added this check so that the tool exits gracefully, rather than crashing, if the name of the executable couldn't be determined.
Should this be awaited in some way?

I can wire it up as async/await if you think it's clearer. I don't think it actually matters though (unless I'm forgetting something) since nothing in the tool cares whether it's foreground or background.
Yeah, I don't think we necessarily need to block anything on this - but we might want to stick a `.then` to handle failures
Added error logging in a `then`. Feel free to alter if you had something else in mind since I'm not sure when I'll next have a chance to iterate on it.
